title: Design file type component architecture system
description:
Design and implement the foundational architecture for organizing file type components in SpringStack.

This epic creates a NodeTypeRegistry system that maps MIME types (and custom MIME-like strings like application/x-folder) to display configurations bundling: icon (Lucide), summary renderer (breadcrumb/list variant), and content renderer (detail view variant).

The registry uses the existing node.kind field as the discriminator, requires no changes to Springstack's core (types.ts, Springstack.tsx, getSlotRenderer), and generates standard SpringstackRenderers via a toRenderers() method.

Scope:
1. registry.ts - NodeTypeRegistry with wildcard matching (image/* -> image/png) and fallback resolution
2. registryComponents.tsx - BaseSummary and BaseContent base components
3. fileTypes/GenericContent.tsx - fallback content renderer
4. Demo migration - reorganize demo data by file type (Documents, Media, Data & Code), use MIME-type kind values, dynamic panel rendering via registry
5. Export updates in index.ts

This must be completed before any individual file type implementation beads can begin.
design:
# Node Type Registry Architecture Plan

## Summary
Create a NodeTypeRegistry system in the Springstack library that maps MIME types (and custom MIME-like strings) to display configurations: icon, summary renderer (breadcrumb/list), and content renderer (detail view).

## Key Design Decisions
- node.kind = MIME type (e.g., image/png, text/markdown, application/x-folder)
- Wildcard matching: image/* matches any image/... kind
- Resolution order: exact match -> wildcard -> fallback
- No Springstack core changes: types.ts, Springstack.tsx, getSlotRenderer all remain untouched
- Immutable registry: register() returns a new registry (good for React memoization)
- Summary = both list + crumb: same renderer used for both slots by default
- File type implementations live in packages/springstack/src/fileTypes/
- Full-featured third-party libraries for content rendering
- Demo reorganized by file type categories (Documents, Media, Data & Code)

## New Files

### 1. packages/springstack/src/registry.ts (pure logic, no JSX)
Core interfaces:
- NodeTypeDefinition<TData>: { icon: LucideIcon, detailLine?, summary?, content? }
- NodeTypeRegistry<TData>: { register(), registerAll(), resolve(), toRenderers(), iconFor(), detailLineFor() }
- ResolvedNodeType<TData>: { matchedKey, icon, detailLine, summary, content }
- createNodeTypeRegistry<TData>(options?): factory function

Resolution algorithm:
1. Exact: definitions.get(kind)
2. Wildcard: definitions.get(kind.split('/')[0] + '/*')
3. Fallback: default definition (generic file icon)

toRenderers() generates:
- Exact entries in list/crumb/panel maps for all non-wildcard registered types
- A default renderer that handles wildcards via the registry's resolve chain

### 2. packages/springstack/src/registryComponents.tsx (React components)
- BaseSummary: icon + title + optional detail line (matches current demo card pattern)
- BaseContent: icon + title + detail line + children slot
These are the default renderers when a NodeTypeDefinition omits summary/content.

### 3. packages/springstack/src/fileTypes/ (directory for implementations)
- index.ts: re-exports all file type components
- GenericContent.tsx: fallback content renderer (file info, no preview)

### 4. apps/demo/src/lib/nodeTypes.ts
Demo registry config mapping MIME types to definitions.

### 5. apps/demo/public/samples/ (directory for sample files)

## Modified Files

### packages/springstack/src/index.ts
Add exports: createNodeTypeRegistry, BaseSummary, BaseContent, all new types.

### apps/demo/src/components/demos/SpringstackDemo.tsx
- Replace buildRenderers() with registry.toRenderers()
- Update kind values to MIME-like strings
- Reorganize demo data into 3 corpora: Documents, Media, Data & Code
- Change item detail panel to dynamically use registry.resolve(node.kind).content
- Update DemoNodeData to include url and type-specific metadata fields

### apps/demo/src/lib/routeUtils.ts
Update kind string comparisons for new MIME-like values.

## Data Model Update
DemoNodeData gains these optional fields:
- url: string (URL to sample file in public/samples/)
- width/height: number (image dimensions)
- durationSec: number (audio/video duration)
- pageCount: number (PDF pages)
- rowCount/columnCount: number (spreadsheet dimensions)
- language: string (code language)
- lineCount: number (code lines)
- itemCount: number (archive file count)

## Demo Data Reorganization
Corpora:
1. "Documents" - markdown, PDF, plain text
2. "Media" - image, audio, video
3. "Data & Code" - code, CSV, Excel, archive

## renderPanels Integration
The item detail panel dynamically uses the registry:
- registry.resolve(node.kind).content renders the type-specific content
- Falls back to BaseContent for types without content renderers
- File type beads only need to register their content renderer, not modify renderPanels

## File Organization in Library
packages/springstack/src/
  registry.ts
  registryComponents.tsx
  fileTypes/
    index.ts
    GenericContent.tsx
    ImageContent.tsx
    AudioContent.tsx
    VideoContent.tsx
    MarkdownContent.tsx
    CodeContent.tsx
    PdfContent.tsx
    SpreadsheetContent.tsx
    ArchiveContent.tsx

## Implementation Order
1. Create registryComponents.tsx (BaseSummary, BaseContent)
2. Create registry.ts (createNodeTypeRegistry, resolution logic, toRenderers)
3. Create fileTypes/GenericContent.tsx (fallback renderer)
4. Update index.ts (add exports)
5. Create apps/demo/public/samples/ directory
6. Create apps/demo/src/lib/nodeTypes.ts (registry config)
7. Reorganize demo data in SpringstackDemo.tsx
8. Update renderPanels to use dynamic registry resolution
9. Update routeUtils.ts for new kind values
10. Build and verify

## Verification
- npm run build succeeds for both workspace packages
- Demo app starts and shows reorganized data with 3 corpora
- Registry resolves correct icons for all item kinds
- Detail lines show correct metadata per type
- BaseContent renders as fallback for types without content renderers
- Morph animations work with MIME-type kind values
- URL routing works with MIME-type kind values

title: Establish frontend BDD test harness if missing
Add SVG file type support
description: Implement content and summary renderers for SVG files (image/svg+xml). SVG has a dual-mode display: rendered preview (inline SVG or img tag) AND source code view (syntax-highlighted XML). The content renderer should provide a toggle between preview mode and source mode. Summary renderer shows a thumbnail preview with dimensions.
design:
## SVG File Support (image/svg+xml)

### MIME Type
`image/svg+xml`

### Icon
`Shapes` from lucide-react (emphasizes vector nature, distinguishes from raster images)

### Dependencies
- Shiki (already used for code highlighting) handles XML/SVG syntax highlighting in source view
- DOMPurify for sanitizing SVG before inline rendering (XSS prevention)

### Summary Renderer (list/crumb)
- Icon: Shapes
- Title: filename
- Detail line: `{width}x{height} SVG` (dimensions from viewBox or width/height attributes)

### Content Renderer (panel) - Dual Mode
Two view modes with a toggle:

**1. Preview Mode (default)**
- Render SVG inline via DOMPurify-sanitized HTML (`dangerouslySetInnerHTML` after sanitization)
- DOMPurify configured with SVG-specific profile: strips script tags, event handlers (onclick etc.), foreign objects, and use/href to external resources
- This approach chosen over img-tag rendering because it preserves CSS inheritance, currentColor support, and allows the SVG to participate in the page's theming
- Checkered/transparent background to show transparency
- Fit-to-container with aspect ratio preserved
- Show dimensions overlay in corner

**2. Source Mode**
- Syntax-highlighted SVG/XML source code via Shiki (xml language)
- Line numbers
- Copy button

### UI Toggle
- Segmented control in top-right: eye icon (preview) and code icon (source)
- Remember last-used mode per session (React state, not persisted)

### DemoNodeData Fields
- `width: number` (from SVG viewBox or width attribute)
- `height: number` (from SVG viewBox or height attribute)

### Sample File
- 1-2 public domain or generated SVGs (a logo or geometric pattern)
- Place in apps/demo/public/samples/media/

### Implementation File
- `packages/springstack/src/fileTypes/SvgContent.tsx`

### Notes
- DOMPurify.sanitize() with { USE_PROFILES: { svg: true, svgFilters: true }, ADD_TAGS: [], FORBID_TAGS: ['script'], FORBID_ATTR: ['onerror', 'onload', 'onclick'] }
- viewBox parsing: extract from root svg element, fall back to width/height attributes
- Register `image/svg+xml` explicitly since it has a custom dual-mode renderer unlike raster images (which only show preview)
- Source mode shares infrastructure with the code/syntax highlighting system

title: Center the local/Cloud selector in top menu bar
description:
The local versus Cloud selector should be positioned at the center of the top menu bar, making it the focal point of the navigation.

Current state:
- Selector is positioned toward the right but not consistently
- No official center alignment
- Positioning is ambiguous and not intentional

Requirements:
- Position selector at exact horizontal center of top menu bar
- Maintain visual balance in the menu bar layout
- Ensure selector remains centered across all screen sizes/breakpoints
- Other menu items (left-side items, right-side items) should balance around center

This is a visual/layout refinement task that improves menu bar visual hierarchy.
design:
VISUAL DESIGN SPECIFICATION

## Menu Bar Layout Structure
Flexbox-based layout with three regions:
1. Left region: Logo, navigation items (flex: 0 0 auto)
2. Center region: Local/Cloud selector (flex: 1 1 auto, centered)
3. Right region: Settings, user menu (flex: 0 0 auto)

## Implementation Approach
Use flexbox with justify-content: center on center region.
Left and right regions use flex: 0 0 auto to maintain fixed width.
Center region uses flex: 1 1 auto to expand and center selector.

## Tailwind Classes
menu-bar: flex items-center justify-between px-4 h-14 bg-card
menu-left: flex items-center gap-4 flex-none
menu-center: flex items-center justify-center flex-1
menu-right: flex items-center gap-4 flex-none
selector: flex items-center gap-2 px-4 py-2 rounded-md bg-muted hover:bg-half-muted cursor-pointer

## Visual Balance
- Left items have fixed width
- Selector centered with flex-1 and justify-center
- Right items have fixed width
- Perfect center alignment regardless of content width

## Responsive Behavior
- On desktop: All regions visible, selector centered
- On tablet: May compress left/right to maintain center
- On mobile: May hide left/right items to preserve center selector visibility

## Related Files
- Look for menu bar component in apps/demo/src/components/
- Check if using Tailwind for styling
- Verify FlexBox flex properties are applied correctly
close_reason: Not applicable: Local/Cloud selector only exists in Biblicus, not Springstack. This bead was created in error. The actual work was tracked in Biblicus-4sx.

title: Add code file support
description:
Implement code file type support (text/javascript, text/typescript, text/python, text/html, text/css, application/json, application/xml, etc.) in the Springstack component system.

Dependencies to install in packages/springstack:
- shiki (syntax highlighting with TextMate grammars, same engine as VS Code)

Files to create:
- packages/springstack/src/fileTypes/CodeContent.tsx

Content renderer behavior:
- Fetch code from node.data.url
- Detect language from node.data.language or infer from MIME type
- Render with Shiki syntax highlighting
- Display line numbers
- Preserve whitespace and indentation
- Horizontal scroll for long lines

Registry entries (in demo nodeTypes.ts):
Multiple registrations for code-related MIME types:
- 'text/javascript', 'text/typescript', 'text/python', 'text/html', 'text/css'
- 'application/json', 'application/xml'
- Wildcard 'text/*' as a catch-all for other text types (lower priority than specific entries)
All use icon: FileCode (from lucide-react), content: CodeContent

Sample file: apps/demo/public/samples/app.tsx
- A TypeScript React component file (~50-100 lines)

Demo data entry (in 'Data & Code' corpus):
{ id: 'app', title: 'app.tsx', kind: 'text/typescript', url: '/samples/app.tsx', sizeKb: 3, language: 'typescript', lineCount: 89 }

Detail line format: 'TypeScript · 89 lines · 3 KB'

Verification:
- Code files show FileCode icon
- Content panel renders syntax-highlighted code
- Line numbers display correctly
- TypeScript, JSON, and other languages highlight correctly
design:
IMPLEMENTATION SPEC

## Dependencies
npm install shiki --workspace packages/springstack

## File: packages/springstack/src/fileTypes/CodeContent.tsx

Component:
1. useState for code string content and highlighted HTML
2. useEffect to fetch(node.data.url).then(r => r.text()) on mount
3. useEffect to highlight code with Shiki once fetched
4. Shiki setup: use createHighlighter() with common languages
5. Render: BaseContent wrapper + highlighted code in <pre><code> block
6. Line numbers via CSS counter or Shiki line numbers feature

## Shiki Integration
- Use shiki's codeToHtml() or codeToTokens() for rendering
- Theme: match Springstack's light/dark mode (e.g., github-light / github-dark)
- Languages to preload: typescript, javascript, python, html, css, json, xml, bash
- Lazy load additional languages as needed

## Language Detection
Map MIME types to Shiki language IDs:
- text/typescript -> typescript
- text/javascript -> javascript
- text/python -> python
- text/html -> html
- text/css -> css
- application/json -> json
- application/xml -> xml
- Fallback: use node.data.language or 'text'

## Styling
- Monospace font (font-mono)
- bg-muted rounded container
- overflow-x-auto for horizontal scroll
- Line numbers in muted color, right-aligned
- Proper padding and line-height

## Registry Registration
Register specific types and a text/* wildcard:
'text/typescript': { icon: FileCode, detailLine: codeLine, content: codeContent },
'text/javascript': { icon: FileCode, detailLine: codeLine, content: codeContent },
'application/json': { icon: FileCode, detailLine: codeLine, content: codeContent },
// etc.

function codeLine(node) {
  const { language, lineCount, sizeKb } = node.data ?? {};
  const parts = [];
  if (language) parts.push(language.charAt(0).toUpperCase() + language.slice(1));
  if (lineCount) parts.push(lineCount + ' lines');
  if (sizeKb) parts.push(sizeKb + ' KB');
  return parts.join(' · ') || undefined;
}

## Sample File: apps/demo/public/samples/app.tsx
A realistic TypeScript React component file, ~50-100 lines.

title: Update URL routing for MIME-type kinds and SQLite drillable tables
description: Update routeUtils.ts to handle MIME-type-based kind values in URL serialization/parsing. Currently routing only knows about root/folder/item/detail kinds. Needs to support: (1) MIME types with slashes in URL path segments (encode/decode), (2) SQLite table drill-down URLs where a user navigates into application/x-sqlite3 then into application/x-sqlite3-table, adding a table-level segment to the URL. This ensures deep links work for all file types including nested SQLite table views.

title: Fix .gitignore to exclude node_modules from git tracking
description:
The node_modules directory is appearing in git status as untracked changes, indicating it is not properly excluded by .gitignore.

Current state:
- node_modules/ shows up in git status
- This bloats the repository and causes unnecessary git tracking
- Standard practice is to exclude node_modules and let npm/package-lock.json manage dependencies

Requirements:
1. Ensure .gitignore includes node_modules/ entry
2. Remove already-tracked node_modules from git index if necessary (git rm -r --cached node_modules)
3. Commit the fix
4. Verify node_modules no longer appears in git status

This prevents:
- Large repository size
- Merge conflicts from node_modules changes
- Accidentally committing platform-specific binaries
- CI/build pipeline bloat

Standard .gitignore entry:
node_modules/
node_modules
.pnp
.pnp.js
design:
GITIGNORE FIX PROCEDURE

## Current Problem
node_modules/ appears in git status as untracked changes

## Root Cause
Either:
1. .gitignore does not include node_modules/ entry, OR
2. node_modules was previously committed and needs to be removed from git index

## Solution Steps

### Step 1: Check/Update .gitignore
Ensure .gitignore contains:


### Step 2: Remove from Git Index (if already tracked)
If node_modules is already in git:
On branch main
Your branch is up to date with origin/main.

Changes not staged for commit:
  (use "git add <file>..." to update what will be committed)
  (use "git restore <file>..." to discard changes in working directory)
	modified:   AGENTS.md
	modified:   apps/demo/src/components/demos/SpringstackDemo.tsx
	modified:   apps/demo/src/main.tsx
	modified:   packages/springstack/src/Springstack.tsx
	modified:   packages/springstack/src/timing.ts
	modified:   packages/springstack/src/typefaces.ts
	modified:   packages/springstack/src/types.ts
	modified:   packages/springstack/src/ui/AnimatedSelector.tsx
	modified:   packages/springstack/src/ui/SpringstackSettings.tsx
	modified:   packages/springstack/src/useSpringstackController.ts

Untracked files:
  (use "git add <file>..." to include in what will be committed)
	.beads/
	.gitattributes
	AGENT_INSTRUCTIONS.md
	ROUTING_DEBUG.md

no changes added to commit (use "git add" and/or "git commit -a")

### Step 3: Verify
On branch main
Your branch is up to date with origin/main.

Changes not staged for commit:
  (use "git add <file>..." to update what will be committed)
  (use "git restore <file>..." to discard changes in working directory)
	modified:   AGENTS.md
	modified:   apps/demo/src/components/demos/SpringstackDemo.tsx
	modified:   apps/demo/src/main.tsx
	modified:   packages/springstack/src/Springstack.tsx
	modified:   packages/springstack/src/timing.ts
	modified:   packages/springstack/src/typefaces.ts
	modified:   packages/springstack/src/types.ts
	modified:   packages/springstack/src/ui/AnimatedSelector.tsx
	modified:   packages/springstack/src/ui/SpringstackSettings.tsx
	modified:   packages/springstack/src/useSpringstackController.ts

Untracked files:
  (use "git add <file>..." to include in what will be committed)
	.beads/
	.gitattributes
	AGENT_INSTRUCTIONS.md
	ROUTING_DEBUG.md

no changes added to commit (use "git add" and/or "git commit -a")

## Related Files
- .gitignore (root directory)

## Best Practices
- node_modules should NEVER be committed
- Dependency management via package-lock.json (npm) or yarn.lock
- CI/CD environments reinstall dependencies fresh
- Keeps repository lean and merge-conflict free

## Testing
After fix:
1. Run npm install to populate node_modules
2. Confirm node_modules not in git status
3. Verify package-lock.json is tracked
4. Test git operations work normally
close_reason: Already resolved: .gitignore contains node_modules entry on line 1, and git status shows no node_modules tracked.

title: Add JSON tree viewer toggle to code component
description: Add a collapsible tree view mode to the existing JSON code component (application/json). This is NOT a separate MIME type - it is a toggle/mode switch on the JSON content renderer that lets users switch between syntax-highlighted code view and an interactive collapsible tree view. The tree view should support expand/collapse of nested objects and arrays, with visual indicators for data types.
design:
## JSON Tree Viewer Toggle (application/json enhancement)

### MIME Type
This is NOT a new MIME type. This enhances the existing `application/json` content renderer.

### Overview
Add a toggle button to the JSON content renderer that switches between two view modes:
1. **Code view** (default): Syntax-highlighted JSON source via Shiki (already planned in the code/syntax highlighting bead)
2. **Tree view**: Interactive collapsible tree representation of the JSON structure

### Dependencies
- No additional dependencies beyond what the JSON/code renderer already uses
- Tree view is implemented as a custom React component (not a third-party tree library)

### Tree View Features
- Collapsible/expandable nodes for objects and arrays
- Visual type indicators: string (green), number (blue), boolean (orange), null (gray)
- Show key-value pairs inline for primitives
- Show item count badges for arrays: `[5 items]`
- Show property count badges for objects: `{3 keys}`
- Expand/collapse all button
- Copy value on click (individual node)
- Search/filter within the tree (highlight matching keys/values)
- Indentation guides (vertical lines connecting parent-child)

### UI Toggle
- Small segmented control or icon toggle in top-right corner of content area
- Two modes: code icon (brackets) and tree icon (list-tree)
- Preserve scroll position when switching modes if possible
- Remember last-used mode per session (React state, not persisted)

### DemoNodeData Fields
- Same as existing JSON: `language: 'json'`, `lineCount`, `itemCount` (top-level keys or array items)

### Sample File
- Use an existing JSON sample or generate one with 3-4 levels of nesting, mixed types, and arrays
- Place in apps/demo/public/samples/data/

### Implementation
- Add tree view component to the existing JSON content renderer file
- The toggle is internal to the content renderer, not a registry-level concern
- This bead depends on the code/syntax highlighting bead being done first (since the code view uses Shiki)

### Notes
- Tree view should handle large JSON gracefully - virtualize if >1000 nodes visible
- Circular reference detection (show [Circular] marker)
- Pretty-print detection: if JSON is minified, tree view still works fine since it operates on parsed object
notes: Dependency: This bead requires Springstack-1ui (code file support with Shiki) to be completed first, since the code view mode uses Shiki for syntax highlighting.

title: Add archive file support
description:
Implement archive file type support (application/zip, application/gzip, application/x-tar) in the Springstack component system.

Dependencies to install in packages/springstack:
- jszip (ZIP file reading and listing)

Files to create:
- packages/springstack/src/fileTypes/ArchiveContent.tsx

Content renderer behavior:
- Fetch archive from node.data.url as ArrayBuffer
- Parse with JSZip to list contents
- Display file tree/list showing: filename, size, compressed size
- Show archive summary: total files, total uncompressed size
- Optionally show compression ratio

Registry entry (in demo nodeTypes.ts):
'application/zip': { icon: Archive (from lucide-react), content: ArchiveContent, detailLine: ... }
'application/gzip': { ... }
'application/x-tar': { ... }

Sample file: apps/demo/public/samples/backup.zip
- A small ZIP file containing a few of the other sample files (readme.md, app.tsx, notes.txt)
- Generate as part of build or manually create

Demo data entry (in 'Data & Code' corpus):
{ id: 'backup', title: 'Project Backup', kind: 'application/zip', url: '/samples/backup.zip', sizeKb: 890, itemCount: 15 }

Detail line format: '15 files · 890 KB'

Verification:
- application/zip items show Archive icon
- Content panel lists archive contents with file names and sizes
- Archive summary (total files, total size) displays correctly
design:
IMPLEMENTATION SPEC

## Dependencies
npm install jszip --workspace packages/springstack

## File: packages/springstack/src/fileTypes/ArchiveContent.tsx

Component:
1. useState for file list (name, size, compressedSize, isDirectory)
2. useEffect to fetch(node.data.url).then(r => r.arrayBuffer()) on mount
3. Parse with new JSZip().loadAsync(buffer)
4. Iterate zip.files to build file list
5. Render as a list/table showing file tree

## File List Display
- Each entry shows: icon (folder or file), name, size
- Directories show folder icon, files show generic file icon
- Sort: directories first, then files alphabetically
- Indentation based on path depth (visual tree)
- Summary row at bottom: X files, Y folders, total size

## Table Styling
- Similar to spreadsheet table but simpler
- Columns: Name (flex), Size (right-aligned), Compressed (right-aligned)
- Header row: bg-muted
- Alternating row colors
- Container: rounded-md overflow-auto max-h-96

## Registry Registration
'application/zip': {
  icon: Archive,
  detailLine: (node) => {
    const { itemCount, sizeKb } = node.data ?? {};
    const parts = [];
    if (itemCount) parts.push(itemCount + ' files');
    if (sizeKb) parts.push(sizeKb + ' KB');
    return parts.join(' · ') || undefined;
  },
  content: (node) => <ArchiveContent node={node} />,
},

## Sample File
Create a ZIP from other sample files (readme.md, app.tsx, notes.txt, metrics.csv).
Can be generated with a script: zip backup.zip samples/*

title: Fix Tailwind config path for springstack source
description:
The Tailwind config in apps/demo/tailwind.config.js references an incorrect path to the springstack source.

Current path (line 7):
  "../../packages/springstack/src/**/*.{js,ts,jsx,tsx}"

Problem:
The relative path assumes the springstack package is at the same level as the demo app, but it actually lives in a different location. This causes Tailwind to fail to scan springstack component styles, resulting in missing style coverage for springstack UI components in the demo.

Required fix:
Change the path to match the actual Springstack repository location:
  "../../Springstack/packages/springstack/src/**/*.{js,ts,jsx,tsx}"

Or adjust based on the actual directory structure where Springstack is located relative to Biblicus/apps/dashboard.

Files affected:
- apps/demo/tailwind.config.js (line 7)
design:
INVESTIGATION & FIX

## Current State
apps/demo/tailwind.config.js line 7:
  "../../packages/springstack/src/**/*.{js,ts,jsx,tsx}"

## Root Cause
The path assumes springstack is a sibling package, but based on actual project structure (Biblicus monorepo contains apps/dashboard which references Springstack separately), the path needs to be corrected.

## Solution
1. Verify actual location of Springstack relative to apps/demo
2. Update path in tailwind.config.js to correct location
3. Test that Tailwind scans springstack files by running build
4. Verify springstack component styles are included in output CSS

## Verification Steps
- Run: npm run build --workspace apps/demo
- Check build output for springstack styles
- Verify no Tailwind warnings about uncovered components
- Test that springstack components render with correct styling
close_reason: Already correct: Path '../../packages/springstack/src/**/*.{js,ts,jsx,tsx}' is valid for monorepo structure. From apps/demo, ../../packages correctly reaches the packages directory at repo root.

title: Add PlantUML file type support
description: Implement PlantUML file type support in the Springstack component system. PlantUML is a declarative language for creating UML diagrams (sequence, class, activity, component, state, etc.) from plain text descriptions. File extensions: .puml, .plantuml, .pu, .wsd MIME type: text/x-plantuml (custom) Dependencies to install in packages/springstack: - plantuml-encoder (encodes PlantUML source to URL-safe format for the PlantUML server rendering API) No heavy local dependency needed - PlantUML diagrams are rendered via the public PlantUML server (https://www.plantuml.com/plantuml/svg/~encoded~) which returns SVG. Alternatively, can use a local PlantUML JAR but that requires Java. Files to create: - packages/springstack/src/fileTypes/PlantUmlContent.tsx Content renderer behavior: - Fetch PlantUML source text from node.data.url - Encode source using plantuml-encoder - Render SVG via PlantUML server URL or display as pointing to the server endpoint - Display source text in a collapsible section below the diagram - Show metadata: diagram type (sequence, class, etc.), line count Registry entry (in demo nodeTypes.ts): 'text/x-plantuml': { icon: Workflow (from lucide-react), content: PlantUmlContent, detailLine: ... } Sample file: apps/demo/public/samples/sequence.puml - A PlantUML sequence diagram with 3-4 actors and several messages - Generate manually: plain text file Demo data entry (in 'Diagrams' corpus): { id: 'sequence-diagram', title: 'Auth Sequence', kind: 'text/x-plantuml', url: '/samples/sequence.puml', sizeKb: 1, diagramType: 'sequence', lineCount: 25 } Detail line format: 'Sequence diagram · 25 lines · 1 KB' Verification: - PlantUML files show Workflow icon - Content panel renders the UML diagram as SVG - Diagram is correctly laid out (actors, messages, lifelines for sequence diagrams) - Source text is viewable
design: IMPLEMENTATION SPEC ## Dependencies npm install plantuml-encoder --workspace packages/springstack plantuml-encoder is a tiny library (~3KB) that encodes PlantUML text into the format expected by the PlantUML server API. No Java or heavy local dependency required. ## Rendering Approach PlantUML diagrams are rendered server-side by the public PlantUML server: - Encode source: plantumlEncoder.encode(source) - Build URL: https://www.plantuml.com/plantuml/svg/{encoded} - Display as or fetch SVG and inline it For offline/self-hosted scenarios, could later add support for a configurable server URL. ## File: packages/springstack/src/fileTypes/PlantUmlContent.tsx Component: 1. useState for PlantUML source text and encoded URL 2. useEffect to fetch(node.data.url).then(r => r.text()) on mount 3. Encode source with plantuml-encoder 4. Build PlantUML server SVG URL 5. Render: BaseContent wrapper + for the diagram 6. Optional: collapsible source text section below diagram ## Diagram Type Detection Parse first line of PlantUML source to detect diagram type: - @startuml -> generic UML (check body for sequence/class/etc) - @startmindmap -> mind map - @startgantt -> Gantt chart - @startwbs -> work breakdown structure - Lines with '->' suggest sequence diagram - Lines with 'class' suggest class diagram ## Registry Registration 'text/x-plantuml': { icon: Workflow, detailLine: (node) => { const { diagramType, lineCount, sizeKb } = node.data ?? {}; const parts = []; if (diagramType) parts.push(diagramType.charAt(0).toUpperCase() + diagramType.slice(1) + ' diagram'); if (lineCount) parts.push(lineCount + ' lines'); if (sizeKb) parts.push(sizeKb + ' KB'); return parts.join(' · ') || undefined; }, content: (node) => , } ## DemoNodeData Additional Fields - diagramType?: string (sequence, class, activity, component, state, etc.) ## Sample File: apps/demo/public/samples/sequence.puml @startuml actor User participant Browser participant API database DB User -> Browser: Login Browser -> API: POST /auth API -> DB: SELECT user DB --> API: user record API --> Browser: JWT token Browser --> User: Dashboard @enduml

title: Implement lazy loading strategy for heavy file type libraries
description: Design and implement a shared lazy loading pattern for heavy third-party libraries used by file type content renderers. Libraries like mermaid (~2MB), sql.js (~1MB), parquet-wasm, and Shiki add significant bundle weight. This bead creates a consistent pattern using dynamic import() with React Suspense boundaries, loading spinners, and error states for failed loads. All file type beads should use this pattern rather than inventing their own.

title: Add Markdown file support
description:
Implement Markdown file type support (text/markdown) in the Springstack component system.

Dependencies to install in packages/springstack:
- react-markdown (markdown to React rendering)
- remark-gfm (GitHub Flavored Markdown: tables, strikethrough, task lists)

Files to create:
- packages/springstack/src/fileTypes/MarkdownContent.tsx

Content renderer behavior:
- Fetch markdown from node.data.url
- Render using react-markdown with remark-gfm plugin
- Apply consistent typography from Springstack typeface settings
- Style headings, code blocks, tables, lists, links
- Support syntax highlighting for fenced code blocks

Registry entry (in demo nodeTypes.ts):
'text/markdown': { icon: FileText (from lucide-react), content: MarkdownContent, detailLine: ... }

Sample file: apps/demo/public/samples/readme.md

Demo data entry (in 'Documents' corpus):
{ id: 'readme', title: 'Project README', kind: 'text/markdown', url: '/samples/readme.md', sizeKb: 4 }

Detail line format: '4 KB'

Verification:
- text/markdown items show FileText icon
- Content panel renders formatted markdown
- Headings, code blocks, tables, lists render correctly
- GFM features (task lists, strikethrough) work
design:
IMPLEMENTATION SPEC

## Dependencies
npm install react-markdown remark-gfm --workspace packages/springstack

## File: packages/springstack/src/fileTypes/MarkdownContent.tsx

Component:
1. useState for markdown string content
2. useEffect to fetch(node.data.url).then(r => r.text()) on mount
3. Loading state while fetching
4. Render: BaseContent wrapper + ReactMarkdown with remarkGfm plugin
5. Apply prose-like typography classes for readable formatting

## Styling
Use Tailwind prose classes or custom styles:
- Headings: font-headline, proper sizing hierarchy
- Code blocks: bg-muted, rounded, monospace font, overflow-x-auto
- Tables: border-collapse, alternating row colors
- Links: text-primary, underline
- Lists: proper indentation and markers

## Registry Registration
'text/markdown': {
  icon: FileText,
  detailLine: (node) => node.data?.sizeKb ? node.data.sizeKb + ' KB' : undefined,
  content: (node) => <MarkdownContent node={node} />,
}

## Sample File: apps/demo/public/samples/readme.md
Create a markdown file that demonstrates:
- H1, H2, H3 headings
- Paragraphs with bold, italic, links
- Unordered and ordered lists
- A fenced code block
- A GFM table
- A task list

File extensions: .vml, .videoml, .babulus.xml
MIME type: application/x-vml+xml (custom)

Dependencies to install in packages/springstack:

- Parse XML to extract metadata (fps, width, height, scene count, duration, title)

title: Generate and source sample files for all file types
description: Create or source sample files for every registered file type in the demo app. Each file type bead specifies what sample it needs in apps/demo/public/samples/. Some are trivial to generate (text, markdown, CSV, JSON) while others need tooling or sourcing (Parquet via Python/pyarrow, SQLite via sqlite3 CLI, Mermaid .mmd, PlantUML .puml, Graphviz .dot, Excalidraw .excalidraw, VML, SVG). All generated content should be original or public domain. Organize under samples/ subdirectories: documents/, media/, data/, diagrams/.

title: Align AnimatedSelector background color with breadcrumb selected state
description:
The AnimatedSelector component currently uses an unknown/inconsistent color for the selection background rectangle that indicates the currently selected option.

Current state:
- Selection indicator has undefined/inconsistent background color
- Used in local/Cloud selector and other reusable selectors
- Does not match the breadcrumb selected state styling

Requirement:
- Change the AnimatedSelector selection background color to match the breadcrumb component selection color
- The breadcrumb uses bg-selected color variable for the active/current position indicator
- AnimatedSelector should use the same color (--selected or bg-selected in Tailwind) for visual consistency

This creates a unified visual language across selection and navigation components.

Files affected:
- packages/springstack/src/ui/AnimatedSelector.tsx
design:
COLOR ALIGNMENT SPECIFICATION

## Current State
AnimatedSelector selection rectangle uses undefined/inconsistent background color.

## Target State
Use same color as breadcrumb selected state indicator.

## Color Reference
Breadcrumb selected state uses: bg-selected (--selected color variable)
From Radix design system, this is the semantic color for indicating current/active position.

## Implementation
In AnimatedSelector.tsx:
1. Locate the selection indicator background styling
2. Change current color to bg-selected
3. Verify consistency with breadcrumb styling
4. May also need to update text color to match breadcrumb foreground for selected items

## Tailwind Classes
Selected background: bg-selected
Selected foreground: text-selected-foreground
These match the breadcrumb component selection styling.

## Visual Impact
- Unified visual language for selection across components
- Users see consistent indication of active/selected state
- Improves overall UI consistency and learnability

## Testing
1. View AnimatedSelector in local/Cloud selector
2. View AnimatedSelector in any other selector components
3. Compare to breadcrumb selected state
4. Verify colors match visually
5. Test in both light and dark modes
close_reason: Completed: Changed AnimatedSelector to use bg-selected and text-selected-foreground in packages/springstack/src/ui/AnimatedSelector.tsx. Now matches breadcrumb styling in both light and dark modes.

title: Settings header scrolls out of view
description:
The Settings panel header (title and Close button) is placed inside the scrollable container, causing it to scroll out of view.

Current implementation (SpringstackSettings.tsx lines 120-131):
- Header div is inside the flex container that has overflow-y-auto
- When user scrolls down in settings, the header scrolls with the content

Problem:
The Close button becomes inaccessible when scrolling through settings content. This is a usability issue - users expect the close affordance to always be visible.

Required fix:
Move the header div outside the scrollable area:
1. Header (lines 121-131) should be outside the overflow-y-auto container
2. Only the settings content (lines 133+) should be scrollable
3. Maintain visual spacing and alignment

Files affected:
- packages/springstack/src/ui/SpringstackSettings.tsx (lines 120-131)
design:
STRUCTURE FIX ## Current Problematic Structure
{/* scrolls with content */}
## Required Structure
{/* stays fixed at top */}
## Implementation Details 1. Extract header outside the overflow container 2. Keep header at top with flex: 0 0 auto sizing 3. Move overflow-y-auto to the content div instead 4. Adjust mt-6 spacing on content to account for header 5. Ensure scrollbar gutter handling remains ## Styling Notes - Header: flex-1 0 auto (takes no extra space) - Content container: flex-1 1 auto with overflow-y-auto - Maintain existing gap-6 and grid layout inside content - Preserve scrollbar-gutter: stable for consistent sizing ## Testing - Scroll settings content to ensure header stays visible - Verify Close button always accessible - Check alignment and spacing look correct - Test on different screen sizes

Add a 'Diagrams' corpus for Mermaid, PlantUML, Graphviz, and Excalidraw. Consider whether SVG belongs in Media or Diagrams. Consider splitting 'Data & Code' if it gets too large with Parquet and SQLite additions. Update demoCorpora, demoItems, and metaLine counts in SpringstackDemo.tsx.

title: Add spreadsheet file support
description:
Implement spreadsheet file type support (text/csv, application/vnd.ms-excel, application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.spreadsheetml.sheet) in the Springstack component system.

Dependencies to install in packages/springstack:
- papaparse (CSV parsing)
- xlsx (SheetJS - Excel file reading)

Files to create:
- packages/springstack/src/fileTypes/SpreadsheetContent.tsx

Content renderer behavior:
- Fetch file from node.data.url
- Parse CSV with PapaParse or Excel with xlsx
- Render data as an HTML table with column headers
- Support horizontal and vertical scrolling for large datasets
- Display row/column counts
- For Excel: support sheet tabs if multiple sheets

Registry entries (in demo nodeTypes.ts):
'text/csv': { icon: FileSpreadsheet, content: SpreadsheetContent, detailLine: ... }
'application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.spreadsheetml.sheet': { ... }
'application/vnd.ms-excel': { ... }

Sample files:
- apps/demo/public/samples/metrics.csv - a CSV file with ~20 rows and 5-8 columns
- apps/demo/public/samples/budget.xlsx - a small Excel file with sample data

Demo data entries (in 'Data & Code' corpus):
{ id: 'metrics', title: 'Sales Metrics', kind: 'text/csv', url: '/samples/metrics.csv', sizeKb: 12, rowCount: 150, columnCount: 8 }
{ id: 'budget', title: 'Q4 Budget', kind: 'application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.spreadsheetml.sheet', url: '/samples/budget.xlsx', sizeKb: 45, rowCount: 200, columnCount: 12 }

Detail line format: '150 rows × 8 columns · 12 KB'

Verification:
- CSV and Excel items show FileSpreadsheet icon
- Content panel renders data table
- Columns align properly with headers
- Scrolling works for overflow content
design:
IMPLEMENTATION SPEC

## Dependencies
npm install papaparse xlsx --workspace packages/springstack
npm install @types/papaparse --workspace packages/springstack --save-dev

## File: packages/springstack/src/fileTypes/SpreadsheetContent.tsx

Component:
1. useState for parsed data (2D array of strings) and headers
2. Detect format from node.kind (CSV vs Excel)
3. For CSV: fetch text, parse with Papa.parse(text, { header: true })
4. For Excel: fetch arrayBuffer, parse with XLSX.read(buffer), get first sheet
5. Render as <table> with <thead> and <tbody>
6. Wrap in scrollable container (overflow-auto, max-h)

## Table Styling
- Tailwind table classes: border-collapse
- Header row: bg-muted, font-semibold, sticky top-0
- Data rows: alternating bg (even:bg-muted/50)
- Cell padding: px-3 py-1.5
- Text: text-sm font-mono for data cells
- Container: rounded-md border overflow-auto max-h-96

## Sheet Navigation (Excel only)
If workbook has multiple sheets:
- Tab bar above table showing sheet names
- Click tab to switch displayed sheet
- Active tab styled with bg-selected

## Registry Registration
const spreadsheetLine = (node) => {
  const { rowCount, columnCount, sizeKb } = node.data ?? {};
  const parts = [];
  if (rowCount && columnCount) parts.push(rowCount + ' rows × ' + columnCount + ' columns');
  if (sizeKb) parts.push(sizeKb + ' KB');
  return parts.join(' · ') || undefined;
};

'text/csv': { icon: FileSpreadsheet, detailLine: spreadsheetLine, content: spreadsheetContent },
'application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.spreadsheetml.sheet': { icon: FileSpreadsheet, detailLine: spreadsheetLine, content: spreadsheetContent },
'application/vnd.ms-excel': { icon: FileSpreadsheet, detailLine: spreadsheetLine, content: spreadsheetContent },

## Sample Files
Generate:
- metrics.csv: header row + ~20 rows of realistic sales data (Date, Product, Region, Units, Revenue, etc.)
- budget.xlsx: generate with xlsx library or use a small public domain Excel file

title: Add SQLite database file type support
description: Implement content and summary renderers for SQLite database files (application/x-sqlite3). This is a complex, drillable file type - similar to pgAdmin, users should be able to drill into tables within the database. Uses sql.js (SQLite compiled to WASM) for browser-based reading. May require nested SpringStack navigation to browse tables and their contents. This is the most complex file type and may need additional architectural consideration for nested drillable content.
design:
## SQLite Database File Support (application/x-sqlite3)

### MIME Type
`application/x-sqlite3`

### Icon
`Database` from lucide-react

### Dependencies
- `sql.js` (npm) - SQLite compiled to WASM, runs entirely in the browser
- Loads .sqlite/.db files and provides full SQL query capability

### Summary Renderer (list/crumb)
- Icon: Database
- Title: filename
- Detail line: `{tableCount} tables` (e.g., '8 tables')

### Content Renderer (panel) - Database Overview
- List of tables with row counts and column counts
- Each table displayed as a card/row that is drillable (clickable)
- Clicking a table drills into a table detail view (see below)
- Database metadata section (collapsible): SQLite version, page size, file size
- Optional: show views and indexes in separate sections

### Drillable Table View
This is the architecturally complex part. When a user clicks a table in the database overview, they should drill into a table detail view that shows:
- Table name as breadcrumb title
- Column schema: name, type, primary key, nullable, default value
- Data preview: first 100 rows in a scrollable data table
- Row count displayed in header
- Optional: simple SQL query input to run custom queries

**Drillable architecture options:**
1. **Nested push**: Push a new SpringstackNode with kind `application/x-sqlite3-table` onto the stack. This keeps the SQLite DB node in the breadcrumb trail and lets the user pop back. The table node's data would include the db reference and table name.
2. **Internal tab/panel**: Handle table navigation inside the content renderer without pushing to the stack. Simpler but loses breadcrumb trail.

**Recommended: Option 1 (nested push)** - This leverages Springstack's navigation naturally. The content renderer for `application/x-sqlite3` renders the table list with cards that call `helpers.push()` to push a table node. Register a separate content renderer for `application/x-sqlite3-table`.

### DemoNodeData Fields
For database node:
- `tableCount: number`
- `fileSize: number`

For table node (application/x-sqlite3-table):
- `tableName: string`
- `rowCount: number`
- `columnCount: number`
- `dbUrl: string` (URL to the .sqlite file, so the table renderer can open it)

### Sample File
- Generate a small SQLite database with 3-4 tables (e.g., a bookstore: books, authors, publishers, reviews)
- Each table with 20-50 rows of realistic data
- Include at least one foreign key relationship
- Place in apps/demo/public/samples/data/

### Implementation Files
- `packages/springstack/src/fileTypes/SqliteContent.tsx` - database overview renderer
- `packages/springstack/src/fileTypes/SqliteTableContent.tsx` - table detail renderer
- Register both `application/x-sqlite3` and `application/x-sqlite3-table` in the registry

### Notes
- sql.js requires fetching the WASM binary; configure the locateFile path or bundle it
- Database handle must be shared between the overview and table views - pass db URL in node data and re-open in table view, or cache the db instance
- Lazy-load sql.js since the WASM binary is ~1MB
- Memory management: close database when navigating away
- For the demo, the SQLite file needs to be fetched as ArrayBuffer, then passed to sql.js
- This is the most complex file type bead and should be implemented last after the architecture and simpler file types are solid
- The nested push pattern (pushing table nodes onto the stack) should be validated with the architecture bead's registry system first
notes: Confirmed: drilling stops at the table level (list of rows with column data). No individual row detail view needed. URL routing for drillable tables is handled by a separate bead.

title: Formalize content renderer signature in registry types
description: The demo currently calls content renderers with two arguments: detailRenderer.content(node, { ...detailRenderer, detailLine }). But SpringstackSlotRenderer is typed as (node: SpringstackNode<TData>) => ReactNode (single arg). The content renderer needs a formalized type that differs from SpringstackSlotRenderer to accept the second argument carrying resolved type info (icon, detailLine, matchedKey). Options: (1) Define a new ContentRenderer type with a second 'context' parameter, (2) Pass context via node.data by enriching it before render, (3) Use React context to provide registry info. This must be resolved in the architecture bead (Springstack-0zt) before file type implementations begin, as it affects every content renderer's function signature.

title: Add Parquet file type support
description: Implement content and summary renderers for Apache Parquet columnar data files (application/x-parquet). Parquet is a columnar storage format common in data engineering. Browser-based reading via parquet-wasm. Display as a data table with column types, row counts, and schema info.
design:
## Parquet File Support (application/x-parquet)

### MIME Type
`application/x-parquet`

### Icon
`Columns` from lucide-react (represents columnar data)

### Dependencies
- `parquet-wasm` (npm) - Apache Parquet reader compiled to WASM for browser use
- Reads .parquet files and exposes schema, row groups, and data as Arrow tables

### Summary Renderer (list/crumb)
- Icon: Columns
- Title: filename
- Detail line: `{rowCount} rows x {columnCount} columns` (e.g., '1,234 rows x 12 columns')

### Content Renderer (panel)
- Schema panel at top: table showing column names, data types, and nullability
- Data preview: first 100 rows displayed in a scrollable data table
- Metadata section (collapsible): row group count, compression codec, created by, file size
- Column headers should show data type icons/badges (int, string, float, bool, timestamp)
- Support column sorting by clicking headers
- Large numeric values should be formatted with locale-appropriate separators

### DemoNodeData Fields
- `rowCount: number`
- `columnCount: number`
- `fileSize: number` (bytes)
- `compressionCodec?: string`

### Sample File
- Generate a small .parquet file with ~50 rows and 5-6 columns of mixed types (string, int, float, boolean, timestamp)
- Could represent something like a sales dataset or sensor readings
- Place in apps/demo/public/samples/data/

### Implementation File
- `packages/springstack/src/fileTypes/ParquetContent.tsx`

### Notes
- parquet-wasm requires WASM initialization; init the WASM module lazily on first use
- File must be fetched as ArrayBuffer before passing to parquet-wasm
- Arrow table conversion gives columnar access; iterate columns for schema display
- Consider a loading spinner while WASM initializes and file parses
- Memory: for very large files, only read first N row groups

title: Add PDF document support
description:
Implement PDF document support (application/pdf) in the Springstack component system.

Dependencies to install in packages/springstack:
- react-pdf (React wrapper around pdf.js for PDF rendering)
- pdfjs-dist (PDF.js library, peer dependency of react-pdf)

Files to create:
- packages/springstack/src/fileTypes/PdfContent.tsx

Content renderer behavior:
- Load PDF from node.data.url using react-pdf
- Render PDF pages with navigation (previous/next/go to page)
- Display current page number and total page count
- Support zoom or fit-to-width
- Canvas-based rendering for crisp text

Registry entry (in demo nodeTypes.ts):
'application/pdf': { icon: FileText (from lucide-react), content: PdfContent, detailLine: ... }

Sample file: apps/demo/public/samples/report.pdf
- A simple multi-page PDF document (2-3 pages)
- Generate with a script or find a small public domain PDF

Demo data entry (in 'Documents' corpus):
{ id: 'report', title: 'Annual Report', kind: 'application/pdf', url: '/samples/report.pdf', sizeKb: 156, pageCount: 12 }

Detail line format: '12 pages · 156 KB'

Verification:
- application/pdf items show FileText icon
- Content panel renders PDF page
- Page navigation works (next/previous)
- Page count displays correctly

title: Fix Local/Cloud selector centering and responsive layout in top menu bar
description:
Fixed the Local/Cloud selector positioning and responsive behavior in the Biblicus dashboard top menu bar.

Completed changes:
- Centered selector on desktop using flex-1 with justify-center
- Made selector move to right side on mobile (justify-end) with flex-1
- Hide text labels on narrow screens using Tailwind arbitrary variant [&_span.text-xs]:hidden
- Fixed icon shrinkage by adding inline style={{ width: 16, height: 16 }} to AnimatedSelector icons
- Set minimum width of 96px for selector container to prevent grid cells from becoming too small
- Icons now maintain 16px size at all viewport widths, matching gear icon behavior

Files modified:
- apps/dashboard/src/components/explorer/StackManager.tsx (lines 407-426)
- apps/dashboard/src/components/ui/animated-selector.tsx (line 160)

Result: Selector properly centered on desktop, moves to right on mobile, icons stay readable size.
close_reason: Completed: Fixed Local/Cloud selector centering and responsive layout. Selector now centers on desktop, moves right on mobile, icons maintain 16px size at all viewports.

title: Add Mermaid diagram file type support
description: Implement content and summary renderers for Mermaid diagram files (text/x-mermaid). Mermaid is a declarative diagramming language that renders flowcharts, sequence diagrams, Gantt charts, class diagrams, and more from text definitions. Client-side rendering using the mermaid JS library.
design:
## Mermaid Diagram Support (text/x-mermaid)

### MIME Type
`text/x-mermaid`

### Icon
`GitBranch` from lucide-react (represents flowcharts/diagrams)

### Dependencies
- `mermaid` (npm) - client-side diagram rendering from text definitions
- Supports: flowcharts, sequence diagrams, class diagrams, state diagrams, ER diagrams, Gantt charts, pie charts, git graphs, and more

### Summary Renderer (list/crumb)
- Icon: GitBranch
- Title: filename
- Detail line: diagram type auto-detected from first line (e.g., 'Flowchart', 'Sequence Diagram', 'Gantt Chart') by parsing the opening keyword (graph/flowchart, sequenceDiagram, gantt, classDiagram, stateDiagram, erDiagram, pie, gitGraph)

### Content Renderer (panel)
- Rendered diagram output via mermaid.render() in a container div
- Below the diagram, show the raw source text in a collapsible code block (syntax-highlighted)
- Handle render errors gracefully: show error message + raw source
- Use a unique ID per render call to avoid mermaid ID collisions
- Re-render on theme changes if dark mode is added later
- Container should be scrollable for large diagrams with optional zoom controls

### DemoNodeData Fields
- `language: 'mermaid'`
- `lineCount: number`
- `diagramType: string` (auto-detected from source)

### Sample File
- Generate a .mmd file with a moderately complex flowchart (10-15 nodes) demonstrating the rendering capability
- Place in apps/demo/public/samples/diagrams/

### Implementation File
- `packages/springstack/src/fileTypes/MermaidContent.tsx`

### Notes
- mermaid.initialize() should be called once with { startOnLoad: false, securityLevel: 'strict' }
- Use mermaid.render() (not mermaid.init()) for controlled rendering
- Each render needs a unique container ID - use node.id as prefix
- Consider lazy-loading the mermaid library since it is large (~2MB)

title: Add Graphviz DOT file type support
description:
Implement Graphviz DOT file type support in the Springstack component system. DOT is a declarative graph description language for rendering directed and undirected graphs, network diagrams, flowcharts, etc.

File extensions: .dot, .gv
MIME type: text/vnd.graphviz (official IANA-registered MIME type)

Dependencies to install in packages/springstack:
- @hpcc-js/wasm-graphviz (Graphviz compiled to WASM, renders DOT to SVG in the browser with zero server dependency)

Files to create:
- packages/springstack/src/fileTypes/GraphvizContent.tsx

Content renderer behavior:
- Fetch DOT source from node.data.url
- Render DOT to SVG using @hpcc-js/wasm-graphviz (Graphviz WASM)
- Display the rendered SVG inline with pan/zoom support
- Show source DOT below or in a toggle
- Display metadata: node count, edge count, layout engine

Registry entry (in demo nodeTypes.ts):
'text/vnd.graphviz': { icon: GitFork (from lucide-react), content: GraphvizContent, detailLine: ... }

Sample file: apps/demo/public/samples/network.dot
- A DOT file with a small directed graph (8-12 nodes, 10-15 edges)
- Demonstrates subgraphs, node shapes, edge labels

Demo data entry (in a 'Diagrams' corpus):
{ id: 'network', title: 'Network Topology', kind: 'text/vnd.graphviz', url: '/samples/network.dot', sizeKb: 2, nodeCount: 12, edgeCount: 15 }

Detail line format: '12 nodes · 15 edges · 2 KB'

Verification:
- DOT files show GitFork icon
- Content panel renders the graph as SVG
- Graph layout is correct (nodes positioned, edges routed)
- SVG is crisp and scalable

title: Add generic file type fallback
description:
Implement the generic/fallback file type content renderer for unknown or unregistered MIME types.

This is the first file type implementation after the architecture bead (Springstack-0zt) and establishes the pattern for all subsequent file type beads.

Dependencies: none (no third-party libraries)

Files to create:
- packages/springstack/src/fileTypes/GenericContent.tsx

Note: GenericContent.tsx may already be created by the architecture bead as a skeleton. This bead ensures it is fully functional.

Content renderer behavior:
- Display file icon (from registry), filename, MIME type
- Show file size
- Display 'No preview available for this file type' message
- Provide a download link if url is available in node.data

Registry entry (in demo nodeTypes.ts):
- Registered as the fallback in createNodeTypeRegistry({ fallback: { icon: File, content: GenericContent, detailLine: ... } })

Sample file: apps/demo/public/samples/notes.txt (a short plain text file)

Demo data entry (in 'Documents' corpus):
{ id: 'notes', title: 'Meeting Notes', kind: 'text/plain', url: '/samples/notes.txt', sizeKb: 2 }

Detail line format: 'text/plain · 2 KB'

Verification:
- Build succeeds
- Unknown MIME types show the generic fallback renderer
- text/plain items show GenericContent in the content panel
- Download link works when url is present
